qas.question: Are the sessions of City Parliament private or public?

context: The sessions of the City Parliament are <a0_0>public<a0_0/>. Unlike members of the City Council, members of the City Parliament are not politicians by profession, and they are paid a fee based on their attendance. Any resident of Bern allowed to vote can be elected as a member of the City Parliament. The parliament holds its meetings in the Stadthaus (Town Hall).
